author: The Editorial Board
title: Better Background Gun Checks
text:
The Parkland, Fla. high school massacre has ignited another gun-control debate, and amid the usual polarization there may be room to compromise. To wit, the House could quickly move a version of a bill it passed last year to improve background checks.
As we’ve learned since Nikolas Cruz killed 17 people at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School, the 19-year-old was a known threat. The Broward County Sheriff’s Office responded to at least 20 complaints about his behavior, and the FBI received a tip in January with specific information...
